newsitem.title: SOUTH AFRICA: RUGBY UNION-MARKGRAAFF SAYS SARFU ACCEPTS RESIGNATION.
newsitem.headline: RUGBY UNION-MARKGRAAFF SAYS SARFU ACCEPTS RESIGNATION.

text.p: Springbok rugby manager Andre Markgraaff said on Wednesday the South African Rugby Football Union (SARFU) had accepted his resignation, tendered after he admitted making racist remarks.
"I have tendered my resignation to SARFU. It was accepted, they did not fire me," he told a news conference in Johannesburg.
"I've been crucified and I have lost all emotional energy, I need time to resettle and think what is important in my life right now but I reiterate I am not a racist."

Markgraaff announced his resignation on Tuesday, a day before a SARFU inquiry into allegations that his was the voice making insulting racist remarks about blacks in a secretly taped conversation, broadcast on national television on Monday.
Acknowledging he had made the comments, Markgraaff said he was stepping down in the interests of South African rugby and apologised to the country's blacks.
The incident has brought fresh embarrassment to a game trying to shake off claims that it is still living in the old apartheid South Africa.
